name: Proximity Hotel

reviews.text: Comfortable and sleek rooms. But not so sleek! Well thought out and spacious as well. Friendly staff. Close to a nice mall that has everything you need and you can get a hotel shuttle to in a cool old style taxi that hotel owns! Traveling here on business and feel very lucky to have the day off in this hotel.
reviews.title: A great stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Highly recommend to anyone.
reviews.title: Best hotel in Greensboro

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Expensive but worth it. The service is 5 star, the hotel is crisp, clean, modern, and unique. The staff is genuine and friendly. The rooms are fantastic!!!
reviews.title: The place to stay

reviews.text: The rooms are all fantastic, make sure you get one with the jacuzzi tub! It is a very quiet and peaceful hotel. Also make sure you eat at Printworks Bistro, especially for Brunch. The Norwegian Breakfast is my favorite with smoked salmon and poached egg over toast.
reviews.title: Pretty good, but overrated

reviews.text: Better for couples, or business than families with small children.
reviews.title: As good as it gets

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I had the pleasure of staying at the Proximity Hotel in Greensboro, NC recently, and we had a wonderful experience.
reviews.title: Great Hotel!!!

reviews.text: The rooms are large and very comfortable. The housekeeping is excellent and the fitness center is more than adequate. We also had dinner at the Print Works Bistro which was very busy. The food was terrific and the bottled craft beer and wine by the glass selections were great.
reviews.title: NO Breakfast?

reviews.text: I would highly recommend the Proximity Hotel for both leisure and business travelers. You will not be disappointed!
reviews.title: Unique and comfy

reviews.text: well, there is a coffee maker in the room but you have to purchase breakfast in the Bistro! I have never stayed at a hotel (especially one where you are paying 250 for a room) that does not have this included - a real shocker!
reviews.title: Green, groovy, and gourmet
A grand space but rather "ehh" for the money
reviews.text: ...and no bath tubs - what is it with new hotels and no bath tubs - grrrrr

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We travel to Greensboro often and our usual go to's for lodging were all booked up we decided to try the Proximity again, although a bit pricier than we had initially wanted. I have to say it was worth every penny. We stayed in a Loft King Center Room room on the 7th floor. Last time we stayed in the Loft King Spa and it was breathtaking. This room was much more roomier and the layout was wonderful. I liked the bathroom was separated more than the Spa room. The Spa rooms are nestled along the long hallways and the Center rooms are on the ends so you have a lot more privacy. We didn't hear a peep and there was a wedding party, Bachelorett's party, etc. there during out stay. The check in was friendly and we were offered assistance with dinner reservations. We ate at the recommended Lucky 32 Southern Bistro and Print Works Bistro. See my reviews for them as well if you are considering trying out the local flair. Hope this is helpful. Happy travels:)
reviews.title: Return trip even better than the first...

reviews.text: I have stayed at the Prox a couple of dozen times. It is great value for the money (from the POV of someone who travels domestically and internationally all the time). My gripe is that in the interest of being GREEN, they have throttled back the water flow from the bathroom sinks to the point of being ridiculous. I have my home faucets lowered to the EPA low flow rate but what ever standard the Prox is using, you can barely shave or brush your teeth.
reviews.title: Great but a couple of issues

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Conversely they happily offer tiny Aveda bottles of soap in the same bathrooms. That must be filling land fills at a ferocious rate. A wall dispenser (as I have seen at some premium hotels internationally) would be fine.
reviews.title: great stay for our anniversary

reviews.text: Please give me back some water at the sink.
reviews.title: Really, just that good

reviews.text: We loved staying at this hotel. It is quiet, clean, & elegant. It's decorated simply & beautifully. We loved the focus on sustainability. Recycle bins in the room made it easy to recycle. The elevators are cool - they generate their own power on the descent to use on the ascent. I loved all the wall hangings/curtains, it really gives a feeling of intimacy & is special. The bed is comfortable. The staff were friendly & professional. Proud to have this hotel in NC!
reviews.title: Do not make a reservation here!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Beautiful exterior. Lobby a little dark and creepy. Could use lighter colors around front desk... Nice furnishings in lobby though. Loft rooms are nice. Great bathroom, really great decor and shower! Great Aveda soaps/shampoos. Nice furnishings in Bedroom. Not crazy about closet and mini-bar/fridge area drapes.
reviews.title: City style hotel

reviews.text: Beautiful bar and restaurant! Great service throughout. Food at restaurant was very good for dinner and brunch!
reviews.title: Great change of pace

reviews.text: More than just loft style rooms, the hotel is a great change of pace from the routine chains. Little construction going on but not intrusive at all. Outstanding restaurant onsite. Wednesday nights are more than just a little crowded. Band at bar is popular with the locals and can make seating or conversation a challenge.
reviews.title: Love to stay here

reviews.text: Actually stayed here four different occasions while house hunting in Greensboro. Consistently pleasant stays. Very green hotel and the staff was always helpful and friendly.
reviews.title: Restaurant

reviews.text: We only had dinner at this fancy hotel but it was amazing!
reviews.title: Unbelievable Hotel

description: Built to use 36% less energy and 30% less water than a comparable hotel, the Proximity Hotel offers a glimpse of the future while celebrating the past. Sustainable practices, custom-designed furnishings, commissioned art and innovative design await guests in every corner of the 147-room luxury "green" hotel and its adjacent restaurant.
